intro: Roucheria griffithiana, commonly known as the Indian sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of northern India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it a hardy species suitable for alpine gardens. Roucheria griffithiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing rocky terrain.
